meta.description: Plaza Premium Lounge (Zone A) at Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport (TPE), Terminal 2. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Plaza Premium Lounge (Zone A)

location.terminalDirections: Take the elevator up to Level 4, Zone A of the Departure Hall.

lounge.description: Travelers looking for comfort and excellent value will undoubtedly feel right at home in this tranquil oasis. Discover delectable culinary options, comfortable seating, charging stations, hot and chilled beverages, and much more.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
regulatory: This lounge is accessible for passengers departing from or transiting through Terminal 2.

reviews.content: Beautiful lounge and possibly my favourite in Taipei.
Best lounge experience so far: beef noodle soup, plenty of other hot foods (both western and Asian), shower, and quiet sofa area separate from dining.  You get as much meal as restaurant and more!
Overall it suffices in a pinch. If there’s no other option it suffices. Food is cold and rarely cleaned up/replaced, seating room is cramped and tight right and washrooms are dirty.
Use the big lounge at the far end. Great hot food straight from the counter. Has showers. Comfy tables. Better than the usual PP, definitely the highest food quality.
EXACTLY like every other Plaza Premium lounge in the world...but worse, in as much as the nicer benefits such as private rooms are an extra cost. I left after 5 minutes.
Like the EVA lounges, seats are so close together. The VIP seats are extra cost of $30+.
This is the bigger lounge at the end, it's 24h as opposed to the other nearby. Only Taiwan beer and not very cold but food is decent and plenty of seating.
The staff was so friendly! But the shower was disgusting. And many of the power outlets were dead or too loose to use. Lastly, the small children running about screaming were not restful.
This is the Plaza lounge on the side (not in the middle) as you will see on the map after you take the escalators upstairs. Comfy, spacious, great food. Only thing missing is windows.
A little tricky to find sometimes.  However the food was tasty...although limited in selection. Lounge was very clean and well kept. Couches were very comfortable! Great WiFi!
Modern, clean lounge. Showers were nice and clean. Western food selection is quite limited. Comfortable seating area. Fast wifi.
Much better than the other one that is in the open.

I’ve got to say, the reviews are right. This is a very nice lounge. I didn’t use the showers, but the food was great, (beer wasn’t very cold) and there’s lots of places to sit, all with charging spots.
This one is the one I like best of the two Plaza Premium Lounges. Good food, service, and selection of soft chairs and tables.
Been to this lounge (zone A) twice and they no longer provide the set menu. Mediocre food and you have to ask for bottles of water.
Food was great, staff was nice, and the beer was cold! What else can you ask for? One of the nicer lounges I have ever visited!
One of the best Plaza Premium lounges in TPE. Staff professional and nice. There were a good selection of hot foods. The free showers were large and very clean. This place is a hidden gem.
Comfortable space and more food choice.
It's quiet and comfortable. The food doesn't live up to the previous reviewers' suggestions though. Apart from the dining and sitting area, other facilities (showers, rooms) are extra.
It's a decent place. They were very kind. Had me sign up for something free so I paid 1150. They allowed me to stay right up until closing, instead of the 2hr max limit. Food is decent, it's quiet :)
This is the larger of the two. If you want buffet, go to A1 lounge. If you want larger, private area, access to showers and limited food, go to this one. Great service and food.
Great atmosphere, showers, and private rooms. One of the best Priority Pass lounges I've been to.
The lounge is very clean and well designed. The shower was amazing — very clean with all amenities. Food is better than others, but simple. But the piano music on repeat makes me wanna stab someone.
This lounge is great. The food is fantastic. The drinks are amazing. Big area with lots of space. Great staff. Highly suggest.
Large lounge. Wine selection is really limited - one red and one white. No other alcohol. Didn't eat food but looked good, fresh, those around me were devouring it. Can't go for seconds though.
Wow the food is amazing,   almost as good as the Thai First Class in BKK. So much better than the other Plaza lounge across about 100 feet away.
Drinks are good. Shower is clean but low pressure. Toilets clean private. Seats comfy. Wifi strong. Staff helpful.

I've been to many Plaza Premium Lounges around the world and the food here is by far the best I have ever had in a lounge. This even beats the Centurion Lounges in the US and I have been to every one.
When you get to the top of the escalator turn around; the lounge you want is directly behind you.
Quiet open resting area. Nice ambience plus varieties of food. Beer, juices, tea, coffee and wine.
Very new, clean, and underused. Lots of space and seats. Good natural light. No lockers, but I was given a VIP room, which includes TV, bathroom, and shower with a large window view of the street.

location.terminalDirections: After security, walk towards the C gates. Take the escalator up one level to the lounge and food court area (to level 4).
4th Floor of the Departure Area, across from The Star and The Infinity.
4th Floor, next to The Star Lounge.
4th Floor, next to The Infinity, across from The Garden.
Take the elevator up to Level 4, Zone A1 of the Departure Hall.

otherLounges.name: Singapore Airlines SilverKris Business Class Lounge
